medical_history.chief_complaint: The association of gastric gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST), paraganglioma, and pulmonary chondroma constituting Carney triad.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Onset of symptoms ranged from ages 7 to 48 years, with a mean age of 20 years. The gastric tumor was usually the presenting tumor in 75% of cases, followed by pulmonary and paraganglionic tumors. Symptoms generally progressed with the development of multifocal tumors.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The presence of multiple tumors including gastric GIST, paraganglioma, and pulmonary chondroma. Patients also manifested conditions like adrenal cortical adenomas and esophageal leiomyomas.
medical_history.family_history: None of the patients had a family history of the tumors.
